meanings.definition: To restore or reinstate (someone) to a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: After the rebellion, the people decided to reenthrone their former king.
meanings.sent2: The queen was reenthroned after a period of exile.
meanings.sent3: The villagers planned to reenthrone the old mayor for a day as a fun tradition.
meanings.sent4: The return of the wise leader reenthroned peace in the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony to reenthrone the emperor was grand and majestic.

meanings.definition: To place (someone) on a throne again.
meanings.sent1: The prince was reenthroned after his long journey.
meanings.sent2: The royal advisor helped reenthrone the rightful heir to the throne.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children decided to reenthrone their favorite toy on the playroom throne.
meanings.sent4: The ancient prophecy foretold the return of the hero to be reenthroned as the savior.
meanings.sent5: The magical spell was cast to reenthrone the lost princess to her rightful place.
